00038 | If your links do not seem to work, try one of the other delicious flavors:
00039 |
00040 | 'AUTO'                        Default - auto detects
00041 | 'PATH_INFO'           Uses the PATH_INFO
00042 | 'QUERY_STRING'        Uses the QUERY_STRING

00044 | 'ORIG_PATH_INFO'      Uses the ORIG_PATH_INFO

00114 | Allowed URL Characters
00115 |--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00116 |
00117 | This lets you specify with a regular expression which characters are permitted
00118 | within your URLs.  When someone tries to submit a URL with disallowed
00119 | characters they will get a warning message.
00120 |
00121 | As a security measure you are STRONGLY encouraged to restrict URLs to
00122 | as few characters as possible.  By default only these are allowed: a-z 0-9~%.:_-
00123 |
00124 | Leave blank to allow all characters -- but only if you are insane.
00125 |
00126 | DO NOT CHANGE THIS UNLESS YOU FULLY UNDERSTAND THE REPERCUSSIONS!!
00127 |
00128 */

00132 /*
00133 |--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00134 | Enable Query Strings
00135 |--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00136 |
00137 | By default CodeIgniter uses search-engine friendly segment based URLs:
00138 | example.com/who/what/where/
00139 |
00140 | By default CodeIgniter enables access to the $_GET array.  If for some
00141 | reason you would like to disable it, set 'allow_get_array' to FALSE.
00142 |
00143 | You can optionally enable standard query string based URLs:
00144 | example.com?who=me&what=something&where=here
00145 |
00146 | Options are: TRUE or FALSE (boolean)
00147 |
00148 | The other items let you set the query string 'words' that will
00149 | invoke your controllers and its functions:
00150 | example.com/index.php?c=controller&m=function
00151 |
00152 | Please note that some of the helpers won't work as expected when
00153 | this feature is enabled, since CodeIgniter is designed primarily to
00154 | use segment based URLs.
00155 |
00156 */
00157 $config['allow_get_array']              = TRUE;
00158 $config['enable_query_strings'] = FALSE;
00159 $config['controller_trigger']   = 'c';
00160 $config['function_trigger']             = 'm';
00161 $config['directory_trigger']    = 'd'; // experimental not currently in use

00163 /*
00164 |--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00165 | Error Logging Threshold
00166 |--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00167 |
00168 | If you have enabled error logging, you can set an error threshold to
00169 | determine what gets logged. Threshold options are:
00170 | You can enable error logging by setting a threshold over zero. The
00171 | threshold determines what gets logged. Threshold options are:
00172 |
00173 |       0 = Disables logging, Error logging TURNED OFF
00174 |       1 = Error Messages (including PHP errors)
00175 |       2 = Debug Messages
00176 |       3 = Informational Messages
00177 |       4 = All Messages
00178 |
00179 | For a live site you'll usually only enable Errors (1) to be logged otherwise
00180 | your log files will fill up very fast.
00181 |
00182 */
00183 $config['log_threshold'] = 4;

00229 /*
00230 |--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00231 | Session Variables
00232 |--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00233 |
00234 | 'sess_cookie_name'            = the name you want for the cookie
00235 | 'sess_expiration'                     = the number of SECONDS you want the session to last.
00236 |   by default sessions last 7200 seconds (two hours).  Set to zero for no expiration.
00237 | 'sess_expire_on_close'        = Whether to cause the session to expire automatically
00238 |   when the browser window is closed
00239 | 'sess_encrypt_cookie'         = Whether to encrypt the cookie
00240 | 'sess_use_database'           = Whether to save the session data to a database
00241 | 'sess_table_name'                     = The name of the session database table
00242 | 'sess_match_ip'                       = Whether to match the user's IP address when reading the session data
00243 | 'sess_match_useragent'        = Whether to match the User Agent when reading the session data
00244 | 'sess_time_to_update'         = how many seconds between CI refreshing Session Information
00245 |
00246 */
00247 $config['sess_cookie_name']             = 'ci_session';
00248 $config['sess_expiration']              = 7200;
00249 $config['sess_expire_on_close'] = FALSE;
00250 $config['sess_encrypt_cookie']  = FALSE;
00251 $config['sess_use_database']    = TRUE;
00252 $config['sess_table_name']              = 'ci_sessions';
00253 $config['sess_match_ip']                = FALSE;
00254 $config['sess_match_useragent'] = TRUE;
00255 $config['sess_time_to_update']  = 300;

00284 /*

00286 | Cross Site Request Forgery
00287 |--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00288 | Enables a CSRF cookie token to be set. When set to TRUE, token will be
00289 | checked on a submitted form. If you are accepting user data, it is strongly
00290 | recommended CSRF protection be enabled.
00291 |
00292 | 'csrf_token_name' = The token name
00293 | 'csrf_cookie_name' = The cookie name
00294 | 'csrf_expire' = The number in seconds the token should expire.
00295 */

00301 /*
00302 |--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00303 | Output Compression
00304 |--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00305 |
00306 | Enables Gzip output compression for faster page loads.  When enabled,
00307 | the output class will test whether your server supports Gzip.
00308 | Even if it does, however, not all browsers support compression
00309 | so enable only if you are reasonably sure your visitors can handle it.
00310 |
00311 | VERY IMPORTANT:  If you are getting a blank page when compression is enabled it
00312 | means you are prematurely outputting something to your browser. It could
00313 | even be a line of whitespace at the end of one of your scripts.  For
00314 | compression to work, nothing can be sent before the output buffer is called
00315 | by the output class.  Do not 'echo' any values with compression enabled.
00316 |
00317 */
00318 $config['compress_output'] = FALSE;
00319

00325 | Options are 'local' or 'gmt'.  This pref tells the system whether to use
00326 | your server's local time as the master 'now' reference, or convert it to
00327 | GMT.  See the 'date helper' page of the user guide for information
00328 | regarding date handling.
00329 |
